fchen

Class SignatureRSA

  • java.lang.Object
    • fchen.SignatureRSA

  • public class SignatureRSA
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements an improved version of the vector signature scheme in PKC'2012. The security can be proven in the standard model under the RSA assumption. The original security is based on the strong RSA assumption.
    Author:
    Chen, Fei (https://sites.google.com/site/chenfeiorange/), First draft on 18-06-2013. License: GNU GPL, Email: chenfeiorange@163.com

        Parameters:
        primeBitLength - length of p,q which determines the security level of the signature scheme
        messageBitLength -

    • Method Detail

      • sign

        public java.math.BigInteger[] sign(java.math.BigInteger[] message,
                          int flag)
        Sign a message, which is an vector of big integers. All arithmetics are done in a finite field or ring. The algorithm is as follows: x^e = g^s * (\product g_i^m_i) * (\product h_i^coefficient_i) mod N; (s,x) is the signature.
        Parameters:
        message - A vector of big integers.
        flag - If flag < 0, the coefficient is included in message, i.e. dimension of message is n + m; else, the coefficient of the message is an unitary vector and 'flag' indicates its non-zero position, i.e. dimension of message is n.
        Returns:
        (s,x)

      • verify

        public boolean verify(java.math.BigInteger[] message,
             java.math.BigInteger[] signature,
             int flag)
        Verify the correctness of the signature of a vector of messages, i.e. checking whether x^e = g^s * (\product g_i^m_i) * (\product h_i^coefficient_i) mod N.
        Parameters:
        message - A vector of messages.
        signature - (s,x)
        flag - If flag < 0, dimension of message is n + m, i.e. the coefficient in contained in the message; else, dimension of message is n.
        Returns:
        true if the signature is correct; else false.

      • combine

        public java.math.BigInteger[] combine(java.math.BigInteger[][] message,
                             java.math.BigInteger[][] signature,
                             java.math.BigInteger[] coefficients,
                             java.math.BigInteger[] newMessage)
        Compute the signature of a linear combination of messages.
        Parameters:
        message - A group of message vectors of dimension n + m.
        signature - A group of message signatures of dimension 2.
        coefficients - Linear coefficients.
        newMessage - The result message of the linear combination. It is used as an output and should be initialized before being passed to the function.
        Returns:
        The signature for the new message.

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey()
        Generate the private and public key for the signature scheme.

      • isKeyValid

        public boolean isKeyValid()
        Check whether gcd(e, p - 1) = 1 and gcd(e, q - 1) = 1.
        Returns:
        'true' if the key is valid; else 'false'

      • precompute

        public void precompute()
        Compute e^-1 mod p - 1 and e^-1 mod q - 1. This helps to find the x such that x^e = t mod N given (e, t, N = p * q).

      • printSecretKey

        public void printSecretKey()
